Uses of Class
com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableException

  • Packages that use ConfigurableException 
    Package Description
    com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable
    Contains classes for building a - typically hierarchically structured - collection of parametrised components that can be configured via a JSON configuration file.

    • Uses of ConfigurableException in com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable

      Subclasses of ConfigurableException in com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ComponentConstructorException
      Indicates that an exception occurred in the constructor of a ComponentBase when trying to instantiate it as a sub-component of another component.
      class  ComponentInitialisationLoopException
      Indicates that two or more components are requesting access to each other during their initialisation.
      class  ComponentMissingConstructorException
      Indicates that a sub-class of ComponentBase does not implement a constructor accepting a ComponentBase and JsonObject as parameter.
      class  ConfigurableMissingConfigurationConstructorException
      Indicates that a sub-class of ConfigurableBase does not implement a constructor accepting a single parameter of type Configuration.
      class  InvalidConfigurableAnnotationException
      Indicates that the element values for an @Parameter annotation are invalid.
      class  InvalidConfigurableFieldException
      Indicates an invalid configuration for a field annotated with Parameter, Configurable, Prototype or Component.
      class  InvalidConfigurationException
      Exception indicating an invalid set of configuration values has been provided.
      class  InvalidParameterFieldException
      Indicates an error with a field annotated @Parameter.
      class  InvalidParameterValueException
      Indicates that the value provided for a @Parameter field in a ComponentBase is invalid (failed validation such as acceptable range or regex matching).
      class  NewInstanceConstructorException
      Indicates that an exception occurred in the constructor of an object being instantiated by ComponentBase#newInstance(Class, Object...).
      class  PrototypeMissingCopyConstructorException
      Indicates that a sub-class of Prototype does not implement a copy constructor accepting a single parameter of the sub-class type.
      class  PrototypeMissingCopyMethodException
      Indicates that a sub-class of Prototype does not override Prototype#copy().
      class  RequiredComponentDefinitionMissingException
      Indicates that a @Component field in a ComponentBase which has no default implementation specified and is not optional has not had a definition specifying an implementation provided for it.
      class  RequiredParameterValueMissingException
      Indicates that a @Parameter field in a ComponentBase which has no default value and is not optional has not had a value provided for it.
